name: S. Szarkowski
summary: Military veteran and PhD with breadth of professional experience. Proven expertise in long- and short-term projects with tight deadlines and changing requirements.

experience.title: Consultant
experience.description: Pro bono consultancy services; advised UCF founder on public relations and media campaigns; orchestrated strategies to raise UCF's social media footprint and fundraising profile; helped plan and implement UCF's initial fundraising campaign, leading to seed money to open a demonstration plot and a partnership with Edinburgh Global Partnerships.

experience.title: Project Editor
experience.description: Primary contact and editor for GE Renewable Energy news project; provided editorial services for client media and news briefs; researched news stories, wrote abstracts, uploaded data, and built newsletters; designed procedures to provide fast, accurate ad-hoc reports on online media trends.

experience.title: Associate Lecturer/PhD Candidate
experience.description: Research student with expertise in security policy, peace building and identity construction in failed states (Afghanistan); conducted historical and contemporary documentary research/analysis; planned, organized and delivered undergraduate lectures and seminars; presented papers at seminars, conferences and workshops.

experience.title: Marine Security Guard
experience.description: Top Secret Security Clearance (Expired); provided internal security for personnel, property and classified materials at United States Embassies; organized two annual Marine Corps Balls with budgets over $40,000; managed Marine Welfare and Recreation fund; previously served as 0331 MOS (Infantry - Machinegunner) at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba.

education.degree: Master of Arts in International Studies
Bachelor of Science in Political Science & Global Studies
